item.title: Team Leader/ Senior Expert in Migration Management and EU-ACP Cooperation
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid Term Review of the programme: Supporting ACP-EU Cooperation on Migration and Development

The team will perform a mid-term evaluation of the first 18-20 months of implementation of the programme, assessing its results and management.

Team Leader/ Senior Expert in Migration Management and EU-ACP Cooperation

  • Higher University degree
  • Relevant experience in ACP countries in some of the following fields: management of labour migration, migration and development, return and reintegration, trafficking in human beings, capacity building in migration management.
  • Knowledge of the situation in ACP countries as regards migration and asylum
  • EU Evaluation experience, and experience of the evaluation of migration programmes is an asset
  • 12 years of experience in Migration management, Migration Studies and related fields. Focus on ACP-EU dialogue priorities is an asset
  • In-depth knowledge of project evaluation methods and techniques (10 years of experience)
  • Professional experience in migration management in developing countries
  • Experience in working on ACP cooperation in regional/country projects with the governments and CSOs (10 years of experience)
  • Fluency in English; French is an asset
  • Previous experience as Team Leader an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Team of 5 Value Chain Analysis Experts (Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to the establishment of a baseline of employment in Rwanda’s Export-oriented Agricultural Value Chains

Global Objective

  • Support the Government of Rwanda in its efforts to increase the contribution of export-oriented agricultural value chains to the country’s poverty reduction, economic- and export growth targets.

Specific Objective

  • Analyse and estimate the distribution of employment within and between various levels of Rwanda’s traditional (coffee, tea, pyrethrum) export-oriented agricultural value chains;

  • Analyse and estimate the distribution of employment within and between various levels of Rwanda’s non-traditional (especially horticulture and if possible hide and skins) export-oriented agricultural value chains;

  • Analyse the dynamics of employment within and along the above mentioned value chains and inclusion of women, youth, poor and disadvantaged groups;

  • Analyse the potential impact of different value chain governance; and value chain upgrading strategies on the employment distribution of Rwanda’s export-oriented agricultural value chains.

  • Define the baseline for the employment in the value chains analysed and a methodology for monitoring progress in the subsequent years.

Team of 5 Value Chain Analysis Experts (Cat. I)

  • At least 12 years successful experience in a field related to the implementation of this contract.
  • Proven English language report writing and communication skills.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience in the survey and analysis of the employment distribution within agricultural value chains.
  • At least one expert with at least 12 years of successful professional experience in measuring and/or analysing decent rural employment, including in the informal sector.
  • At least one expert with at least 6 years of successful professional experience in analysing the Coffee value chain.
  • At least one expert with at least 6 years of successful professional experience in analysing the Tea value chain.
  • At least one expert with profound experience in analysing the Pyrethrum value chain.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience in analysing Fruit & Vegetable value chains.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience in analysing Hide & Skins value chains.
  • t least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience in analysing Rwanda’s export-oriented agricultural value chains.
  • Expertise with other high-value chains (e.g. flowers, essential oils, Macadamia, Stevia, etc.), that are relevant for Rwanda, will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Upto 5 Key Experts (all Category I) in the Irrigation Sector
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance in the Establishment of a Baseline of Beneficiaries of Public Investments in Irrigation Infrastructure

GLOBAL OBJECTIVE

Support the Government of Rwanda in its efforts to increase the efficiency, effectiveness, sustainability, leverage and impact of public investments in irrigation and to enhance the agriculture sectors' contribution to Rwanda’s poverty reduction-, economic growth- and export growth targets and to decrease farmer’s vulnerability to climate change, drought and flooding.

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES

  • Establish a baseline of agricultural households using irrigation systems (their number, gender, perceptions, plot size under irrigation, cultivated crops, major challenges)

  • Complete the 2015 assessment of irrigation infrastructure built through public spending.

  • Complete the 2015 assessment of the use of irrigation infrastructure built through public spending.

  • Identify the cooperatives and water user associations accessing irrigation infrastructure.

  • Complete the 2015 assessment of the status, capacities and constraints of Water User Associations.

  • Support the Government of Rwanda in the country-wide assessment of the existing water storage structures with a minimum size of 120m³ or above.

  • Identify targeted policy actions to determine and improve water and land productivity in the agriculture sector.

  • Define a methodology for monitoring progress in the subsequent years and a periodicity.

Project duration: 180 days

Upto 5 Key Experts (all Category I) in the Irrigation Sector (total of 200 working days)

For all Experts the following requirements should be fulfilled:

Qualifications and skills: Education at least Masters Degree or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience in a field related to the implementation of this contract.

General professional experience: At least 12 years successful experience (for category I experts) or 6 years successful experience (for category II experts) in a field related to the implementation of this contract.

Language Skills: Proven English language report writing and communication skills.

In addition the team should cover all together the following requirements:

Professional experience:

  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience in large surveys related to irrigated agriculture.
  • At least one expert with at least 12 years of successful professional in ensuring the sustainable management transfer (Water User Associations and/or private operators) of irrigation infrastructure and in supporting capacity building and capacity assessment of Water User Associations.
  • At least one expert with at least 12 years of successful professional in the economic appraisal and of public investments in irrigation infrastructure.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional in the design and construction of irrigation infrastructure.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional in analysing the hydrology for irrigation investment projects.
  • At least one expert with at least 12 years of successful professional in the environmental appraisal of public investments in irrigation infrastructure.
  • At least one expert with at least 12 years of successful professional in the social appraisal and of public investments in irrigation infrastructure.
  • At least one expert with at least 8 years of successful professional experience with irrigation schemes and water storage systems in Rwanda.
  • At least one expert with profound knowledge of the key stakeholders in Rwanda’s irrigation and water resources management sector.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Planning and Performance Management Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review of the National Programme for Sub-National Democratic Development (SNDD)

The overall purpose of this MTR is to identify and justify a set of clear recommendations to improve and adjust the NP and its implementation. Prior to making these recommendations, a review of relevance, implementation progress, effectiveness, efficiency, constraints and key issues will be carried out. This review is an intermediate step aimed at collecting compelling evidence and providing the clear reasoning required to design actions that will be adopted to improve performance.

These recommendations will be in several areas, including recommendations: (i) to revise the NP; (ii) to better implement the second IP3; (iii) to improve the results frameworks, to ensure targets are realistic and credible and that the indicators selected can be used to effectively manage performance, (iv) to outline a broad strategy and indicative costs for the third platform of the NP, and (v) to improve program management, coordination, capacity development, evaluation capacity and learning and other key institutional processes.

The MTR will be considered successful to the degree there is buy-in in terms of its findings and to the degree it results in actual changes in the future. As such, the first and foremost user of the Mid-Term Review will be the Royal Government of Cambodia, and particularly the NCDD-S.

Development partners supporting the NP-SNDD will also be main users. The NP is mainly funded through a basket-fund program based approach, administered by the NCDD-S. Sida, Switzerland and the EU are the contributors to the basket fund. The NP is also implemented through bilateral agreements between the RGC and donors such as ADB, UNDP, UNICEF, UN women, UNFPA, World Bank, GIZ/BMZ, as well as civil society.

Planning and Performance Management Expert (Category II): 25 person-days

Qualifications and skills: Education: at least a Master’s Degree/MBA; in its absence, equivalent 9 years professional experience in management (including general professional experience listed below).

General professional experience: At least 6 years' experience in management.

Specific professional experience: The expert must demonstrate substantive experience in the following areas:

  • Design, implementation and assessment of monitoring and evaluation systems;

  • Design, implementation and assessment of performance management systems;

  • Participation as expert in at least one evaluation.

  • At least one experience in M&E and performance management in the public sector context

  • Prior experience in decentralisation, deconcentration, local governance, will be an advantage

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category 1 - Capacity Building Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance for Identification and Formulation of 11th EDF Support for Civil Society

The global objective is to assist the government of Botswana and the European Commission in the three phases of programming of EU’s development cooperation with Botswana under the 11th EDF for support to civil society.

The specific objective is to provide the Government of Botswana and the European Commission with sufficient information to finalise, in good time, the identification and formulation phases of EU support for civil society, under the 11th EDF.

Category 1 - Capacity Building Expert

Education

  • A least a Master’s Degree in Social Sciences, Political Science, Development Economics or Public Administration or equivalent educational background of professional experience.

General Professional Experience

  • A minimum of 12 years of work experience designing, implementing and/or managing measures to build the capacity of civil society organisations.

Specific Professional Experience

  • At least 10 years of experience in developing capacity enhancement and organisational sustainability strategies for civil society in upper middle income countries
  • Extensive knowledge of participatory organisation analyses and needs diagnostics.
  • Experience with design and delivery of training support to various forms of CSOs
  • Extensive knowledge of resource mobilisation strategies for CSOs
  • Experience with effective networking approaches for CSOs.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

item.title: Expert-Comptable
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assistance technique auprès du Ministère du Commerce et de la Consommation pour la gestion du devis programme de 950 000 pour la mise en œuvre de l'APE-I

L’objectif de la mission est de permettre l’atteinte des résultats visés dans le devis programme à travers une gestion technique et financière et contractuelle saine, efficace et efficiente.

Expert-Comptable (CAT. III, 82 h/j):

Formation:

  • Diplôme d'expert-comptable ou équivalent;

Expérience professionnelle générale:

  • Expérience confirmée (3 ans minimum) dans la gestion de projets de développement complexes impliquant la tenue d’une comptabilité analytique détaillée ;
  • Grande aptitude de travail en équipe ;
  • Maitrise des outils informatiques les plus courants : traitement de texte, tableurs, base de données, internet et des logiciels de comptabilité;

Expérience professionnelle spécifique:

  • Expérience des procédures FED exigée (procédures de gestion administrative, financière et contractuelle de la coopération extérieure de l’UE);
  • Au moins trois expériences dans la gestion de devis-programmes selon les règles du FED avec des montants de Devis-Programmes supérieurs à €800K
  • Parfaite maîtrise du français,
  • Connaissance du malgache serait un atout

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert au Commerce et au Secteur Privé (Chef de mission)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assistance technique auprès du Ministère du Commerce et de la Consommation pour la gestion du devis programme de 950 000 pour la mise en œuvre de l'APE-I

L’objectif de la mission est de permettre l’atteinte des résultats visés dans le devis programme à travers une gestion technique et financière et contractuelle saine, efficace et efficiente.

Expert au Commerce et au Secteur Privé (Chef de mission) (CAT. II, 72 h/j):

Formation :

  • Diplôme Universitaire de niveau Master au moins ou équivalent en Commerce international, Economie, Sciences Sociales, Sciences Politiques, ou Etudes du développement.

Expérience professionnelle générale:

  • 6 ans d'expérience au moins dans des projets de développement, notamment dans l'appui au commerce et au secteur privé.
  • Parfaite connaissance des procédures FED exigée.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique:

  • Expériences en tant que régisseur d'un devis programme du FED serait un atout.
  • Capacité d’écoute, attitude coopérative et de concertation, sens du dialogue et de la communication.
  • Parfaite maîtrise du français

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Business Process Re- Engineering Experts (x3) – Cat. I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Re-engineering Services (Business Process Re-engineering) for Delivery of Improved Services to Citizens

The overall objective is to support public finance and public administration reforms aiming to enhance accountability and public service delivery through improved Government performance.

The specific objective is to prepare five reengineering studies of five selected service processes in the five selected institutions.

Business Process Re- Engineering Experts (x3) – Cat. I

  • Master’s Degree level;
  • 7 years of experience in design and delivery of BPR (two years in the ENP region);
  • Experience of successful BPR processes at public or private organisations;
  • Experience working with Governments at the central level in middle income countries;
  • One expert needs experience with the Jordanian Public Sector;
  • One expert needs to be fluent in business Arabic and English and be able to use BPR software programmes.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
